snippet: Lawyers for the 1970s sitcom “Three’s Company” have attacked the Off Broadway play “3C” on copyright grounds.
abstract: Playwright David Adjmi considers contesting a cease-and-desist letter sent by the copyright owner of the long-gone television sitcom Three's Company, which claims that Adjmi's play 3C borrows too many elements from the series and is not enough of a parody to be protected under First Amendment exceptions to copyright law.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the 1970s sitcom “Three’s Company” have attacked the Off Broadway play “3C” on copyright grounds.

headline.seo: ‘Three’s Company’ Lawyers Object to the Play ‘3C’
headline.main: If Three Constitutes Company, Add Lawyers to Make It a Crowd
